posts.question: How do you identify early signs of crop diseases?

replies.reply: Leaf changes – Yellowing, browning, curling, or spots appearing.  Stunted growth – Plants stop growing as expected.  Wilting – Leaves droop even when soil has enough moisture.  Unusual spots or patches – Brown, black, or white marks on leaves, stems, or fruits.  Mold or powdery coating – White, grey, or black growth on plant surfaces.  Stem or root damage – Cracks, rot, or soft spots near the base.
I suggest you that  Inspect fields at least twice a week, especially after rains or sudden weather changes, because diseases spread fastest in those conditions.
